Posts.Content: Day One done ...  Most of you know how terrified i was but you know what,  it was ok. The staff here at my hospital are fab & there's a lovely relaxed atmosphere. I'm cold capping & that was the worse bit. Apart from the added time, i had a constant headache but i coped. Had my hickman line inserted too before chemo so a bit battered & bruised but onwards ...... Hopefully the SE won't be too bad. Good luck to those starting over the next few days. You'll be fine! Geraldine xx
Posts.Title: *** May Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Skye01, sorry for delay responding. I'm 2 days in from having the line inserted. During the procedure you will feel some tugging but keep your eyes closed & try to relax. The staff will reassure you all the way through. Afterwards you will experience some discomfort when swallowing but that soon wears off. Now, i hardly know it's there & will have some stitches removed & the line flushed on tues. When having chemo, the line made the procedure very easy. Wishing you lots of luck xx
Posts.Title: *** May Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Sarah, wishing you lots of luck with your 1st chemo today. You will be fine. Thinking of you.  Geraldine xx
Posts.Title: *** May Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, Thanks for your kind thoughts ...  however, after my pre-chemo chat on Fri it was decided to put me back a day as I need a hickman line inserted so starting tomorrow instead. Feeling slightly anxious but want it to start. Geraldine x
Posts.Title: *** May Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: lynnwad, you will be fine. I've been really anxious & stressed for weeks but now I feel I'm on the road to recovery, as tough & bumpy that road is we will do it. Stay strong and positive! xx
Posts.Title: *** May Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Jammyfiona, our diagnosis is almost the same. I'm also triple negative with 5/26 nodes affected. I'm started FEC-T on Mon 9th and absolutely dreading it but reading these posts is very encouraging. Good luck to all May starters Geraldine x
